intro: Nesaea angolensis, commonly known as the Angola nesaea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly Angola and Namibia, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. Its leaves are typically narrow and linear, adapted to reduce water loss in its harsh habitat. Nesaea angolensis is often found in rocky soils and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
